definition: to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: The opposition dismissed the report as a whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 反對黨認爲這份報告文過飾非不予理會。

sentences.english: You should admit and correct your mistakes rather than cover them up.
sentences.chinese: 有錯誤就該承認並改正，你怎麼能文過飾非呢？

sentences.english: False, that is exaggerated, insincere, courteously but without sincerity, cover-up.
sentences.chinese: 假，就是誇大其詞，言不由衷，虛與委蛇，文過飾非。

sentences.english: The opposition claimed the report was a whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 反對派聲稱這份報告文過飾非。

sentences.english: Kelly described the failure of the report to recommend criminal prosecutions as a complete whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 凱利還稱這份提出刑事控訴的報道文過飾非。
